name: Floor Dips
how_to_perform:
1. Start by sitting on the floor with your legs extended out in front of you and your feet together.
2. Place your hands on the ground beside your hips, fingers pointing forward.
3. Bend your knees slightly so that your heels are on the ground and your feet are flat.
4. Press into your hands to lift your hips off the ground, creating a reverse table-top position.
5. Your arms should be supporting your weight and your body should be straight from head to knees.
6. Bend your elbows to lower your body down towards the floor, keeping your back close to your hands.
7. Pause when your elbows are at about a 90-degree angle, then press back up to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
8. Repeat for the desired number of reps, making sure to move slowly and with control.
short_summary: Floor Dips are a bodyweight exercise that targets the triceps, chest, and shoulders without the need for equipment.
